connector.description: Poll the weather information from Open Weather Map.

camel.sink.path.name.name: camel.sink.path.name
camel.sink.path.name.description: The name value is not used.

camel.sink.endpoint.appid.name: camel.sink.endpoint.appid
camel.sink.endpoint.appid.description: APPID ID used to authenticate the user connected to the API Server

camel.sink.endpoint.headerName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.headerName
camel.sink.endpoint.headerName.description: To store the weather result in this header instead of the message body. This is useable if you want to keep current message body as-is.

camel.sink.endpoint.language.name: camel.sink.endpoint.language
camel.sink.endpoint.language.description: Language of the response. One of: [en] [ru] [it] [es] [sp] [uk] [ua] [de] [pt] [ro] [pl] [fi] [nl] [fr] [bg] [sv] [se] [zh_tw] [zh] [zh_cn] [tr] [hr] [ca]

camel.sink.endpoint.mode.name: camel.sink.endpoint.mode
camel.sink.endpoint.mode.description: The output format of the weather data. One of: [HTML] [JSON] [XML]

camel.sink.endpoint.period.name: camel.sink.endpoint.period
camel.sink.endpoint.period.description: If null, the current weather will be returned, else use values of 5, 7, 14 days. Only the numeric value for the forecast period is actually parsed, so spelling, capitalisation of the time period is up to you (its ignored)

camel.sink.endpoint.units.name: camel.sink.endpoint.units
camel.sink.endpoint.units.description: The units for temperature measurement. One of: [IMPERIAL] [METRIC]

camel.sink.endpoint.weatherApi.name: camel.sink.endpoint.weatherApi
camel.sink.endpoint.weatherApi.description: The API to use (current, forecast/3 hour, forecast daily, station) One of: [Current] [Station] [Hourly] [Daily]

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.geoLocationProvider.name: camel.sink.endpoint.geoLocationProvider
camel.sink.endpoint.geoLocationProvider.description: A custum geolocation provider to determine the longitude and latitude to use when no location information is set. The default implementaion uses the ipstack API and requires geolocationAccessKey and geolocationRequestHostIP

camel.sink.endpoint.httpClient.name: camel.sink.endpoint.httpClient
camel.sink.endpoint.httpClient.description: To use an existing configured http client (for example with http proxy)

camel.sink.endpoint.cnt.name: camel.sink.endpoint.cnt
camel.sink.endpoint.cnt.description: Number of results to be found

camel.sink.endpoint.ids.name: camel.sink.endpoint.ids
camel.sink.endpoint.ids.description: List of id's of city/stations. You can separate multiple ids by comma.

camel.sink.endpoint.lat.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lat
camel.sink.endpoint.lat.description: Latitude of location. You can use lat and lon options instead of location. For boxed queries this is the bottom latitude.

camel.sink.endpoint.location.name: camel.sink.endpoint.location
camel.sink.endpoint.location.description: If null Camel will try and determine your current location using the geolocation of your ip address, else specify the city,country. For well known city names, Open Weather Map will determine the best fit, but multiple results may be returned. Hence specifying and country as well will return more accurate data. If you specify current as the location then the component will try to get the current latitude and longitude and use that to get the weather details. You can use lat and lon options instead of location.

camel.sink.endpoint.lon.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lon
camel.sink.endpoint.lon.description: Longitude of location. You can use lat and lon options instead of location. For boxed queries this is the left longtitude.

camel.sink.endpoint.rightLon.name: camel.sink.endpoint.rightLon
camel.sink.endpoint.rightLon.description: For boxed queries this is the right longtitude. Needs to be used in combination with topLat and zoom.

camel.sink.endpoint.topLat.name: camel.sink.endpoint.topLat
camel.sink.endpoint.topLat.description: For boxed queries this is the top latitude. Needs to be used in combination with rightLon and zoom.

camel.sink.endpoint.zoom.name: camel.sink.endpoint.zoom
camel.sink.endpoint.zoom.description: For boxed queries this is the zoom. Needs to be used in combination with rightLon and topLat.

camel.sink.endpoint.geolocationAccessKey.name: camel.sink.endpoint.geolocationAccessKey
camel.sink.endpoint.geolocationAccessKey.description: The geolocation service now needs an accessKey to be used

camel.sink.endpoint.geolocationRequestHo.name: camel.sink.endpoint.geolocationRequestHostIP
camel.sink.endpoint.geolocationRequestHo.description: The geolocation service now needs to specify the IP associated to the accessKey you're using

camel.component.weather.lazyStartProduce.name: camel.component.weather.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.weather.lazyStartProduce.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.weather.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.weather.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.weather.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
